description.narrative: PAM plans to improve the labour conditions and management system by analysing the demographic imbalance, making sound decision based on enhanced reporting mechanisms and upgrading its services quality for all economic and social actors.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Output 2.1: - Research programmes deliver data and knowledge that support evidence-based policy-making in PAM. - PAM has greater understanding of how non-market factors impact labour mobility in GoK and recommendations on how to address this. - # of adjustments to PAM procedures carried out to better align with labour market objectives, as per recommendations of report. Output 2.1: - GoK/PAM have new information available to further improve and/or expand the shelter - GoK/PAM have new skills and knowledge regarding shelter management - GoK/PAM exposed to best practices, lessons learned, and able to share information on shelter management - GoK/PAM informed of the operational and cost advantage of AVRR - Migrants are returned home voluntarily and provided with reintegration assistance. Output 3.1: No of Government, Employers and Workers representatives participated in a Standards training course in the ILO Training Centre in Turin. Output 3.2: No. of workshops held on the ratification and application of conventions 100, 111, 122, 129,187, and 189. Output 3.3: - International Labour Standards taken into account in court proceedings - No of trainers and judges from Kuwait trained in the ILO Training Centre in Turin - No of Information materials produced in Arabic Language. Output 3.4: - Number of capacity building workshops held on ILS implementation for parliamentarians. Output 4.1: 1- Number of Employees of Public Authority of Manpower leadership team trained. 2-Number of Enforcement Priorities established & Enforcement Plan developed. Output 4.2: - Assessment and recommendations completed Output 4.3: - Action Plan developed. Output 4.4: - Enforcement Plan implemented. Output 4.5: - National OSH Policy, Profile and Programme are produced. Output 4.6: - Number of training courses are conducted on basic OSH and risk assessment. Output 4.7: - No of OSH specialists receiving specialized training on the use of OSH equipment Output 4.8: - No of training courses for W

comment.narrative: Output 2.1: - No research capacity to support evidence-based policy development. - Limited knowledge of non-market drivers of labour mobility. - Labour Mobility Management Structures not fully aligned with GoK’s labour market and economic development goals. Output 2.2: - No available assessment of shelter - No. of workshops held on shelter management - No of study tours held on shelter management - No of technical roundtables on shelter management - No available information on feasibility of AVRR - No migrants assisted with AVRR. Output 3.1: Not enough training to Kuwait Government and social partners, on reporting. Output 3.2: - Insufficient capacity related to international labour standards. Output 3.3: - Not enough training on international Labour Standards. Output 3.4: - No capacity building workshops to parliamentarians held. Output 4.1: 1- No training of a leadership team. 2- No enforcement priorities and no existing plan. Output 4.2: - No existing Labour inspection assessment Output 4.3: - No action plan Output 4.4: - No action plan Output 4.5: - No existing national OSH profile. Output 4.6: - Not enough training of inspectors on OSH. Output 4.7: - No technical capacity of inspectors for monitoring environmental pollutants in the workplace Output 4.8: - weak capacity of employers’ and workers’ representatives on LI and OSH. Output 4.9: - No existing tools. Output 5.1: - No team assembled for the data gathering - No database for gathering and storing data - No data analyzed in graphical form - No data analyzed from month to month Output 5.2: - No database for gathering and storing data - No process for reporting formulated at PAM -No reporting team established Output 5.3: - No training conducted on PAM staff to create, and produce the reports - No training conducted for remaining PAM staff to understand and analyze reports.

ILO: 1. Enhanced skills anticipation frameworks and certification system by the responsible government agencies.
2. Strengthened fair recruitment process for foreign workers through legislative and regulatory changes
3. Improved protection of women and men foreign workers, including through enhanced dispute prevention and resolution mechanism and enhanced access to justice procedure for foreign domestic workers
4. Strengthened inclusive dialogue on labor mobility with countries of origin in the establishment of fair recruitment corridor.
5. Improved legal framework and structures of SD and capacities of social partners

IOM: 1.1 Organize a workshop for PAM introducing IRIS under Ethical Recruitment and how to use IRIS. 1.2 Organize cascade training for recruitment agencies to rollout IRIS certification with IOM closely following up. 1.3 Facilitate technical support and recommendation for PAM governmental Contracts’ Division to mainstream Nazaha and ethical recruitment principles. 2.1 Organize consultation with relevant stakeholders to agree on key components at the mobile application 2.2 Facilitate the scope and the design of the mobile application (Beta version)
ILO: 1. Enhanced skills anticipation frameworks and certification system by the responsible government agencies.
2. Strengthened fair recruitment process for foreign workers through legislative and regulatory changes
3. Improved protection of women and men foreign workers, including through enhanced dispute prevention and resolution mechanism and enhanced access to justice procedure for foreign domestic workers
4. Strengthened inclusive dialogue on labor mobility with countries of origin in the establishment of fair recruitment corridor.
5. Improved legal framework and structures of SD and capacities of social partners

ILO outputs from 1,2,3 and 5 were delivered successfully in 2020.
ILO Output 4 moved to 2021.

IOM: 1.1 Organize a workshop for PAM introducing IRIS under Ethical Recruitment and how to use IRIS. 1.2 Organize cascade training for recruitment agencies to rollout IRIS certification with IOM closely following up. 1.3 Facilitate technical support and recommendation for PAM governmental Contracts’ Division to mainstream Nazaha and ethical recruitment principles. 2.1 Organize consultation with relevant stakeholders to agree on key components at the mobile application 2.2 Facilitate the scope and the design of the mobile application (Beta version)
ILO Output 4.Strengthened inclusive dialogue on labor mobility with countries of origin in the establishment of fair recruitment corridor

IOM:
1.2,1,2, and 1.3 deliverables have been delivered in full and approved by the beneficiary 2.1 and 2.2 have been canceled
ILO Output 4 is still under revision for approval by PAM and the government.
